result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice Spann

records.addlTxt:
10:55 AM Defendant Maurice Spann in court.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Maurice Spann.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for status. 
Negotiations are ongoing. Defendant provides updated contact information.
Hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Maurice Spann
Current: 926 East Moreland, Waukesha, WI 53186 United States  (Effective: 09-16-2022)
Prior: 1444 Big Bend Rd,#A, Waukesha, WI 53189

10:32 AM Defendant Maurice Spann in court with attorney Brandon K. Carlson.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Carlson was recently appointed and just received discovery.
Defense has not received an offer yet.
State sends offer.  Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel - Atty Brandon Carlson

Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

01:07 PM Defendant Maurice Spann in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 07/14/2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
